sect1.title: Skills
sect1.para: A Skill is an acquired ability, one that a character learns.

sect2.title: Skill Competency
sect2.para: A Skill is composed of two parts:

listitem.para: Talent (Tal) (determined by the two Talents relevant to the Skill)
Training Level (Tr Lvl) (determined by experience with the Skill)

row.entry: (A character who has no Training with a Skill.)
(A character who has Training but low Talent.)
(A character who has learned his Skill.)
(A character who is proficient with his Skill.)
(A character who is an expert with his Skill.)
(A character who is a master with his Skill.)
(A character who is legendary with his Skill.)

sect2.para: All skills confer the following abilities:

listitem.para: A character who has Tr > 0 in a skill can recognize the use of that Skill by another.
A character who has Tr > 0 in a skill can recognize the Competency level of another person with the same Skill.
A character can determine the actual Skill Level of another if the character's Skill Level is greater than the other person's.

sect2.title: Skill Costs
sect2.para: All Skill costs are measured in EPs, also called Base Cost. The higher BC, the harder the Skill is to learn and master.

sect2.title: Untrained Penalty
sect2.para: When a character attempts a Task for which he has not been Trained (Skill Competency is 'No Skill'), or to which no Skill is related, he suffers an Untrained Penalty (UP).
Some Skills will have a special UP of Impossible. This indicates that the Skill cannot be attempted when Skill Competency is 'No Skill'.

para.emphasis: Optional: The UP is generally equal to 5 but can be changed by the GM. The GM may set a higher UP for a Task that is normally performed using a Skill requiring a lot of knowledge or practice (Difficult and Very Difficult Skills). In the same way, the GM may reduce or eliminate the UP for Tasks that are primarily based on Talents (ex: holding one's breath), or that do not benefit much from knowledge or practice (Trivial and Easy Skills).
As a guideline, a UP of twice the Base Cost of the related Skill is suggested for Tasks that are normally performed using a Skill.

sect3.title: Skill Acquisition
sect3.para: The following table can be used to look up the EP cost for advancing a Skill from a Training Level of 0 to the desired Training Level in one step. This table is most useful when creating a character and buying skills for the first time.
Skill Acquisition Formula:

para.literal: EP Cost = Desired Tr Lvl * (Desired Tr Lvl + 1) * BC / 2

example.title: Skill Acqusistion
example.screen:
If Argis the ranger wants to start his Tracking Skill (BC = 4 EP) at Training Level 8, he must spend:
EP Cost = Desired Tr Lvl * (Desired Tr Lvl + 1) * BC / 2 = 8 * 9 * 4 / 2 = 144 EP

sect3.para: For those who prefer not to use the formula, a table is provided.

sect3.title: Skill Advancement
sect3.para: To increase a Skill to its next Training Level, a character must spend a number of EPs equal to the next Training Level times the Base Cost of the Skill.
Skill Advancement Formula:

para.literal: EP Cost = Next Tr Lvl * BC

example.title: Skill Advancement

sect3.para: For those who prefer not to use the formula, a table is provided.

para.emphasis: The methods presented below aim to better model the relations between Skill use, Talents and Skill advancement. Some of them can be combined with the standard method, while others replace it.

emphasis.literal: Teaching Bonus = d10-d10* + Teachers Teaching Skill - Students Next Skill Level
Students EP = (d10-d10* + Teaching Bonus + Students Avg(Tals, INT) - (5 * BC - 10)) / 5

para.emphasis: Where Tals are the students Talents on the Skill he's Training and INT is the students Intelligence.
Note: A teacher may not train a student to a higher Skill Level than that he himself has in the Skill the student is Training, minus 1.

screen.emphasis: If Ronan wants to train his Tracking Skill to Skill Level 5, he must find a Teacher with Tracking Skill Level of at least 6.

para.emphasis: Replace Teachers Teaching Skill with UP of the Teaching Skill:

emphasis.literal: Teaching Bonus = d10-d10* + UP - Students Next Skill Level
Students EP = (d10-d10* + Teaching Bonus + Students Avg(Tal,Adv,INT) - (5 * BC - 10)) / 5

para.emphasis: Where Tals are the students Talents on the Skill he's Training and INT is the students Intelligence.

sect3.title: Artistic Skills

formalpara.title: Acting
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to convincingly portray a character either from a literary work or of one's own creation. This includes improvisational acting.

formalpara.title: Disguise
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to alter one's general appearance in order to avoid identification and deceive opponents. Encompasses alteration of height, weight, posture and/or facial and body features. Often combined with the Acting Skill.

formalpara.title: Art
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to draw and paint life-like images as well as impressionistic images.

sect3.para: Confers proficiency in an instrument of choice.
Confers the ability to shape and mold clay, stone and wood into life-like images of various sizes and compositions.

formalpara.title: Ventriloquism
formalpara.para: Confers the seeming ability to project one's voice so that it appears to emanate from inanimate objects, other people, or unusual locations. Good for party tricks and for starting ale-house brawls.

sect3.title: Athletic Skills

formalpara.title: Acrobatics
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to swing from a chandelier, somersault through a stained glass window, and land on one's horse, ready to make a getaway. Can be used in combat to dodge or reduce the effects of a blow.

sect3.para: Enables the reduction of falling damage by such methods as slowing the rate of descent by incidental surface contact, harm minimising impact postures, and "dodging the spikes/aiming for the soft bits."
Enables safe transition along a strong rope strung between two points or any similarly narrow and (generally) high-up path.

formalpara.title: Climbing
Contortion
formalpara.para: Enables the manipulation of one's body in order to move through small openings, hide in absurdly small containers or edifices, and escape from bonds.

formalpara.title: Endurance
formalpara.para: Enables prolongation of application with regard to physically demanding and/or mentally draining tasks. A swimmer nears exhaustion towards the end of long swim; they apply their endurance skill, and if successful, can continue swimming anew, as if refreshed for half as long again. Successive uses of the skill increase task difficulty and reduce prolongation span.

formalpara.title: Juggling
formalpara.para: Confers an ability to manipulate balls and other objects primarily for entertainment purposes. Subsumes minor sleight-of-hand techniques.

formalpara.title: Jumping
formalpara.para: Confers a proficiency at spanning sudden drops such as those encountered during rooftop chases or across mountain gorges, ready leaps onto elevated stations such as tavern tables and desparation jumps out of first or second story abodes.

formalpara.title: Sprinting
formalpara.para: Through a combination of running and power-walking, enables movement at twice the normal rate for a fixed duration. A period of rest and recuperation is required at the end of such exertion.

formalpara.title: Swimming
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to float upon deep water and to traverse same in a limited fashion. Heavy accoutrements, exhaustion, wounds, cold water, and high waves make things harder.

sect3.title: Craft Skills

formalpara.title: Agriculture
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to raise plants for various reasons (crops, reforestation, etc.). This Skill also allows the character to identify plants. Includes related fields such as horticulture and botany.

formalpara.title: Armorer
formalpara.para: Enables the construction and repair of metal, mesh and/or material armour. NB: historically spans the trades of Armorer, Heaumer (helmets), and Targeter (shields).

formalpara.title: Blacksmithing
formalpara.para: Enables the working of iron to produce and repair domestic and agricultural items.

formalpara.title: Bowyer
formalpara.para:
Enables the construction and repair of bows, x-bows, arrows, and arrowheads.
NB: historically spans the trades of Bowyer, Crossbow Makre, Fletcher (arrows), Arrowsmith (arrowheads), and Stringer (bow strings).

formalpara.title: Cooking
formalpara.para:
Enables the preparation of divers foods including flesh-meat and poultry, pasties, and confections.
NB: Historically spans the trades of Cook, and Confectioner.

formalpara.title: Clayworking
formalpara.para: Enables the working and firing of clay pieces to produce glazed and painted jars, pots and tiles.

formalpara.title: Leatherworking
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to make items from leather or other skins, including clothing, armour, saddles, etc. This skill includes the ability to etch, carve and stamp leather for design and artistic value, but does not confer the aritistic ability to make this work of high quality (see Drawing/Painting skill)

formalpara.title: Medicine
formalpara.para: (Includes First Aid) Confers the ability to attenuate pain, stop bleeding, and prevent further injury as a result of cuts, bruises, abrasions, burns, broken and sprained limbs, bites and stings (see section 6.4 - Healing*).

sect3.para: Enables two types of healing: emergency and palliative.

Emergency healing can lessen the severity of a new wound. Treatment must commence within 1 minute following the wounding. TD is 5 per point of injury the healer attempts to recover. Add 5 to TD for each attempt after the first on the same character inside the same day.

example.title: Emergency Healing
example.screen: Ronan sustains a 12 point wound; Kara attempts to reduce it to a 9 point wound. TD will be 15. If Ronan had been treated by Kara once already on that day, TD would instead be 20.

sect3.para: Palliative healing enables natural healing to occur at the rate of 20% of (BOD + 25) per day of low activity and 10% of (BOD + 25) per day of moderate activity, provided the care-giver makes a Healing roll at TD 5 for each patient under his care.

Medicine Skill can also be use to alleviate the effects of poisoning and to diagnose and treat illnesses. A Healer who comes to the aid of a poisoned or diseased individual can attempt to reduce the Virulence of the Affliction. The Healer's TD for this action is 5 per point of Virulence the Healer attempts to remove.

example.title: Healing Poisoning

sect3.para: This must be done before the poisoned character begins to suffer the full effects of the affliction (see Affliction in section 9.3*).

formalpara.title: Mining
formalpara.para: Confers a knowledge of ore prospecting, geological surveying, and extraction techniques and hazards.

formalpara.title: Rope Use
formalpara.para: Enables the character to tie effective knots for a variety of uses including mountaineering, restraint, building rope bridges, etc. Also includes splicing two pieces of rope together, care of rope, types and sizes of ropes needed for various jobs, etc.

formalpara.title: Stonemason
formalpara.para: Enables the shaping and dressing of stones used in the construction of houses, towers, and castles.

formalpara.title: Weaponsmithing
formalpara.para:
Enables the construction and repair of knives, swords and miscellaneous weapons.
NB: Historically spans the trades of Blader/Bladesmith (blades), Cutler or Swordsmith/Sword-Cutler (handles), Sheather (sheath/scabbard), Weaponsmith (everything else bar knives, bows, and swords).

formalpara.title: Woodworking
formalpara.para: Enables the construction of common items from wood, including furniture of all types, utensils, and even buildings. While this skill allows the construction of high quality objects, it does not confer the ability to artistically carve or paint the items into true works of art (see Drawing/Painting and Sculpture/Carving skills).

sect3.title: Knowledge Skills

formalpara.title: Appraising
formalpara.para: Enables the considered determination of the value of a range of curiosa including objets d'art, jewelry, and collectibles. Easier if the item in question can be handled; harder if applied by sight or by description or from drawing alone.

formalpara.title: Cartography
formalpara.para: Allows one to make accurate map from topographical measurements. Also confers the ability to make reliable maps while traveling a region or visiting a building.

formalpara.title: Cryptography
formalpara.para: Confers proficiency in the field of codes, ciphers, and code-breaking.

formalpara.title: Engineering
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge of design and construction principles especially those of a public utility nature such as bridges, roads, aqueducts, harbours, and drainage works. Military Engineering concentrates on the construction of military works (including engines of destruction) for attack or defence.

formalpara.title: Geography
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge of matters concerning the description of a world's surface, its form and physical features, natural and political divisions, climate, resources, and populations of various countries.

formalpara.title: Heraldry
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge of the etiquette of chivalry, including the genealogies and armorial bearings of noble families, laws of succession, and orders of precedence.

formalpara.title: Herbalism
formalpara.para: Confers a knowledge of the medicinal properties of herbs and plants.

formalpara.title: Identify Artifacts
formalpara.para: Subsumes a general knowledge of the reputed origin and history of artefacts. Enables one so learned to recognise such items and to speculate as to their application and usefulness.

formalpara.title: Language
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge of a verbal communication medium whether ancient, modern, or esoteric.

sect3.para: NB: Dead and forgotten languages tend to have greater training requirements and higher TD ratings.

formalpara.title: Law
formalpara.para: Understanding soscial laws of a spesific culture, region, etc.

formalpara.title: History
formalpara.para: Confers an academic type knowledge of a past civilisation ("Atlantis") or a more generalised knowledge of a specific period of history (4th Century A.D.).

sect3.para: May also be used for detailed knowledge of the development, stories, and events surrounding a thorp, county, province or region; the smaller the area, the more detailed the knowledge. Extends to such things as notable battlefields, regional politics, rumours, scandals, flood, fire and drought, lost treasures and the like.

formalpara.title: Metallurgy
formalpara.para: Confers a knowledge of metals and their behaviour under stress. Enables the identification of most types by virtue of familiarity with their physical characteristics.

formalpara.title: Read/Write
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to understand and prepare written communication mediums.

formalpara.title: Theology
formalpara.para: Confers a general knowledge of the more significant of a world's religions. Includes creation and world building lore, deity virtues and spheres of influence, liturgical rites and practices, notable heroes, orders and authorities, sanctions, holy days and places, and religious festivals.

formalpara.title: Zoology
formalpara.para: Confers a knowledge of animals and their characteristics including diet, behaviour, activity cycles, friends, enemies, and habitat.

sect3.title: Nature Skills

formalpara.title: Animal Training
formalpara.para: Enables the training of domestic animals and beasts so as to obey instructions and learn specified routines.

sect3.para: At higher TD levels can be used to train semi-wild and wild animals and at the heights of the art, confer rudimentary speech in the more intelligent and cooperative types.

formalpara.title: Direction Sense
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to determine true north through a combination of familiarity with heavenly aspects, sensitivity to geomagnetic flux lines, and natural psychic affinities. Harder during the day, on occluded nights, and when underground.

formalpara.title: Fire-building
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to start a small fire suitable for camping purposes. Ignition methods include eye-glass, flint and steel, and simple fricative. Difficulty varies according to environment and atmospheric conditions.

formalpara.title: Fishing
formalpara.para: Enables the use of rod, net, and weir to catch a wide variety of species including pike, carp, trout, eels, catfish, lampreys and crabs.

formalpara.title: Foraging
formalpara.para: Enables survival off the land by virtue of familiarity with natural food and water sources, and their extraction/safe preparation methodologies.

formalpara.title: Hunting
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to track and bag beasts of the hunt such as bears, wild boar, deer, foxes, hares, grouse, wild duck, and geese, by virtue of familiarity with their habitat, behaviour, and anatomy.

formalpara.title: Navigation
formalpara.para: The ability to find one's position using the sun/stars, currents, ...

formalpara.title: Riding
formalpara.para: Enables the riding of beasts of burden and conveyance over lands both clear and rough, in a safe and comfortable fashion.

formalpara.title: Seamanship
formalpara.para: Confers a familiarity of working life aboard a water borne vessel and the practices and hazards of such a calling. Enables the safe passage of a water-borne ship through doldrum and tempest by virtue of familiarity with the heavens and the vagaries of wind and current.

formalpara.title: Survival
formalpara.para: Each Survival Skill conveys survival ability based on location/climate. Examples include Woodlands, Desert, Mountains, Arctic etc. Survival allows a character to build shelter, find food and water, etc...

formalpara.title: Tracking
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to track all forms of ground based creatures.

formalpara.title: Weather Sense
formalpara.para: Enables the anticipation of forthcoming meteorological phenomena.

sect3.title: Social Skills

formalpara.title: Bardic Influence
formalpara.para: Facilitates the mood alteration of a passive listener or group of people through song, melody, humour and/or tragedy.

sect3.para: At higher TD levels can be used to counter the effects of sirens and the like, and heal solely by the purity of voice and/or instrument.

formalpara.title: Bribery
formalpara.para: Facilitates the circumvention of cumbersome laws, the cooperation of agents of inspection, and the ready consideration of petitions and entreaties and the like. Minimises the consequences of a rebuff.

formalpara.title: Drinking
formalpara.para: Subsumes a good knowledge of alcoholic beverages. Enables one to drink those not so skilled, under the table.

formalpara.title: Eating
formalpara.para: Confers an epicurean knowledge of food and wine. Depending on one's bent can also be used to out-gross those without the Skill, in pig-out competitions.

formalpara.title: Etiquette
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge of the proper mode of dress, behavior, and language when speaking to nobility.

formalpara.title: Gambling
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to master games of chance either by "reading the odds" or by subtle manipulation/substitution of game equipment and paraphernalia.

formalpara.title: Haggling
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to negotiate price effectively, including having an idea of when the price of an object has been inflated. To be the most effective, the use of this skill requires the character to have some idea of the true value of the item being haggled over.

formalpara.title: Interrogation
formalpara.para: This skill is used to extract special information through the use indiscriminate physical and mental persuasion.

formalpara.title: Oration
formalpara.para: Enables the conveyance of ideas and concepts to groups of people ranging from small assemblies to raucous multitudes. Often used (and abused) by religious leaders and holders of public office, whether benign or corrupt, prospective or incumbent.

formalpara.title: Streetwise
formalpara.para: Confers familiarity with the ways of the street. Enables neutral interaction with members of urban underclasses, the location of discrete accommodation and food sources, and access to street knowledge, strongarms for hire, outlets for the acquisition and disposal of illicit or "borrowed" property, and similar questionable activities.

formalpara.title: Truthtell
formalpara.para: Enables one to tell when a human, demi-human, or humanoid is lying by watching the subject's eyes, breathing, and so on.

sect3.title: Subterfuge Skills

formalpara.title: Evade Pursuit
formalpara.para: Confers knowledge in the detection and evasion of persuit including effective hiding, switchbacks, covering tracks, etc.

formalpara.title: Forgery
formalpara.para: Enables the production of facsimile documents, forged artwork, and artifical imitations of valuable stones and items of jewellery.

formalpara.title: Hiding
formalpara.para: Enables the observation of goings-on from a position of concealment such as amidst a naturally camouflaged field or from within the depths of urban shadows. Can avoid house-to-house and all points searches by moving surreptitiously from hidey hole to darkened corner.

formalpara.title: Lipreading
formalpara.para: Enables the discernment of what is being said by the observation and interpretation of lip motion. Useful across a crowded room if discretion is required.

formalpara.title: Move Quietly
formalpara.para: Facilitates movement which avoids the rustle of clothing and the padding of footsteps. Good for sneaking up on guards and sentries.

formalpara.title: Open Locks
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to defeat locks and like security devices by manipulating their mechanical componentry.

formalpara.title: Pick Pockets
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to extract baubles and the like from the pockets and purses of unsuspecting marks.

formalpara.title: Remove Traps
formalpara.para: Enables the character to disarm or harmlessly set off common types of traps.

formalpara.title: Searching
formalpara.para: Confers the ability to find something initially hidden. When a character activly tries to find something, he's Searching for it.

sect3.para: Also enables the detection of mechanically based traps: whether a small poisoned needle in a jewelry box or a pressure plate activated falling block in a passage. The character assays the item/area in question and is able to detect small irregularities in construction or tell-tale differences in contrast or surface homogeneity. Higher proficiency levels confer a limited ability to sense temperature inconsistencies and magical augmentation emanations.

formalpara.title: Set Traps
formalpara.para: Enables the character to install and build common types of traps.
